sentence.Network_en: The vitriol he hurled at members of the press knew no bounds.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对媒体的尖刻抨击没完没了。

sentence.Network_en: He has been no stranger to controversy and vitriol during a tumultuous political career.
sentence.Network_cn: 在起伏不定的政治生涯里，他对争议和讥讽早已习以为常。

sentence.Network_en: His attack on the government was pure vitriol.
sentence.Network_cn: 他纯粹出于恶意抨击政府.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting the sulphate of various metals): from Old French, or from medieval Latin vitriolum, from Latin vitrum 'glass'

entry.tran: 尖刻的文字;刻薄的话;讽刺
entry.def: If you refer to what someone says or writes as vitriol, you disapprove of it because it is full of bitterness and hate, and so causes a lot of distress and pain.

example.ex: The vitriol he hurled at members of the press knew no bounds...
example.tran: 他对媒体的尖刻抨击没完没了。

example.ex: He has been no stranger to controversy and vitriol during a tumultuous political career.
example.tran: 在起伏不定的政治生涯里，他对争议和讥讽早已习以为常。

means.word_mean: 1. (H2SO4) a highly corrosive acid made from sulfur dioxide; widely used in the chemical industry
2. abusive or venomous language used to express blame or censure or bitter deep-seated ill will
1. expose to the effects of vitriol or injure with vitriol
